Offence: Abetment of any offence, if the act abetted is committed in consequence, and where no express provision is made for its punishment.
Punishment: Same as for offence abetted.
Cognizable?: According as offence abetted is cognizable or non-cognizable.
Bailable?: According as offence abetted is bailable or non-bailable.
Triable By: Court by which offence abetted is triable.

Offence: Abetment of any offence, if the person abetted does act with different intention from that of abettor.
Punishment: Same as for offence abetted.
Cognizable?: According as offence abetted is cognizable or non-cognizable.
Bailable?: According as offence abetted is bailable or non-bailable.
Triable By: Court by which offence abetted is triable.

Offence: Abetment of any offence, when one act is abetted and a different act is subject to the proviso.
Punishment: Same as for offence abetted.
Cognizable?: According as offence abetted is cognizable or non-cognizable.
Bailable?: According as offence abetted is bailable or non-bailable.
Triable By: Court by which offence abetted is triable.

Offence: Abettor when liable to cumulative punishment for act abetted and for act done.
Punishment: Same as for offence abetted.
Cognizable?: According as offence abetted is cognizable or non-cognizable.
Bailable?: According as offence abetted is bailable or non-bailable.
Triable By: Court by which offence abetted is triable.

Offence: Abetment of any offence, when an effect is caused by the act abetted different from that intended by the abettor.
Punishment: Same as for offence committed.
Cognizable?: According as offence abetted is cognizable or non-cognizable.
Bailable?: According as offence abetted is bailable or non-bailable.
Triable By: Court by which offence abetted is triable.

Offence: Abetment of any offence, if abettor present when offence is committed.
Punishment: Same as for offence committed.
Cognizable?: According as offence abetted is cognizable or non-cognizable.
Bailable?: According as offence abetted is bailable or non-bailable.
Triable By: Court by which offence abetted is triable.

Offence: Abetment of an offence, punishable with death or imprisonment for life, if the offence be not committed in consequence of the abetment.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years and fine.
Cognizable?: According as offence abetted is cognizable or non-cognizable.
Triable By: Court by which offence abetted is triable.

Offence: If an act which causes harm to be done in consequence of the abetment.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 14 years and fine.
Cognizable?: According as offence abetted is cognizable or non-cognizable.
Triable By: Court by which offence abetted is triable.

Offence: Abetment of an offence, punishable with imprisonment, if the offence be not committed in consequence of the abetment.
Punishment: Imprisonment extending to one-fourth of the longest term provided for the offence, or fine, or both.
Cognizable?: According as offence abetted is cognizable or non-cognizable.
Bailable?: According as offence abetted is bailable or non-bailable.
Triable By: Court by which offence abetted is triable.

Offence: If the abettor or the person abetted be a public servant whose duty it is to prevent the offence.
Punishment: Imprisonment extending to one-half of the longest term provided for the offence, or fine, or both.
Cognizable?: According as offence abetted is cognizable or non-cognizable.
Bailable?: According as offence abetted is bailable or non-bailable.
Triable By: Court by which offence abetted is triable.

Offence: Abetting commission of an offence by the public or by more than ten persons.
Punishment: Imprisonment which may extend to 7 years and fine.
Cognizable?: According as offence abetted is cognizable or non-cognizable.
Bailable?: According as offence abetted is bailable or non-bailable.
Triable By: Court by which offence abetted is triable.

Offence: Concealing design to commit offence punishable with death or imprisonment for life, if the offence be committed.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years and fine.
Cognizable?: According as offence abetted is cognizable or non-cognizable.
Triable By: Court by which offence abetted is triable.

Offence: If offence be not committed.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years and fine.
Cognizable?: According as offence abetted is cognizable or non-cognizable.
Triable By: Court by which offence abetted is triable.

Offence: A public servant concealing a design to commit an offence which it is his duty to prevent, if the offence be committed.
Punishment: Imprisonment extending to one-half of the longest term provided for the offence, or fine, or both.
Cognizable?: According as offence abetted is cognizable or non-cognizable.
Bailable?: According as offence abetted is bailable or non-bailable.
Triable By: Court by which offence abetted is triable.

Offence: If the offence be punishable with death or imprisonment for life.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 10 years.
Cognizable?: According as offence abetted is cognizable or non-cognizable.
Triable By: Court by which offence abetted is triable.

Offence: If the offence be not committed.
Punishment: Imprisonment extending to one-fourth of the longest term provided for the offence, or fine, or both.
Cognizable?: According as offence abetted is cognizable or non-cognizable.
Triable By: Court by which offence abetted is triable.

Offence: Concealing a design to commit an offence punishable with imprisonment, if offence be committed.
Punishment: Imprisonment extending to one-fourth of the longest term provided for the offence, or fine, or both.
Cognizable?: According as offence abetted is cognizable or non-cognizable.
Bailable?: According as offence abetted is bailable or non-bailable.
Triable By: Court by which offence abetted is triable.

Offence: If the offence be not committed.
Punishment: Imprisonment extending to one-eighth part of the longest term provided for the offence, or fine, or both.
Cognizable?: According as offence abetted is cognizable or non-cognizable.
Triable By: Court by which offence abetted is triable.

Offence: Criminal conspiracy to commit an offence punishable with death, imprisonment for life or rigorous imprisonment for a term of 2 years or upwards.
Punishment: Same as for abetment of the offence which is the object of the conspiracy.
Cognizable?: According as the offence which is the object of conspiracy is cognizable or non-cognizable.
Bailable?: According as offence which is object of conspiracy is bailable or non-bailable.
Triable By: Court by which abetment of the offence which is the object of conspiracy is triable.

Offence: Any other criminal conspiracy.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 6 months, or fine, or both.

Offence: Attempting to commit offence punishable with imprisonment for life, or imprisonment, and in such attempt doing any act towards the commission of the offence.
Punishment: One half of the imprisonment for life, or imprisonment not exceeding one-half of the longest term, provided for the offence, or fine, or both.
Cognizable?: According as the main offence is cognizable or non-cognizable.
Bailable?: According as the offence attempted by the offender is bailable or non-bailable.
Triable By: The court by which the offence attempted is triable.

Offence: Rape.
Punishment: Rigorous imprisonment for not less than 10 years but which may extend to imprisonment for life, and fine.

Offence: Rape by a police officer or a public servant or member of armed forces or a person being on the management or on the staff of a jail, remand home or other place of custody or women's or children's institution or by a person on the management or on the staff of a hospital, and rape committed by a person in a position of trust or authority towards the person raped or by a near relative of the person raped.
Punishment: Rigorous imprisonment for not less than 10 years but which may extend to imprisonment for life which shall mean the remainder of that person's natural life and fine.

Offence: Persons committing offence of rape on a woman under sixteen years of age.
Punishment: Rigorous imprisonment for not less than 20 years but which may extend to imprisonment for life, which shall mean imprisonment for the remainder of that person's natural life and fine.

Offence: Persons committing offence of rape on a woman under twelve years of age.
Punishment: Rigorous imprisonment for not less than 20 years but which may extend to imprisonment for life which shall mean imprisonment for the remainder of that person's natural life and with fine or death.

Offence: Person committing an offence of rape and inflicting injury which causes death or causes the woman to be in a persistent vegetative state.
Punishment: Rigorous imprisonment for not less than 20 years but which may extend to imprisonment for life, which shall mean imprisonment for the remainder of that person's natural life, or death.

Offence: Sexual intercourse by husband upon his wife during separation.
Punishment: Imprisonment for not less than 2 years but which may extend to 7 years and fine.
Bailable?: Bailable. (only on the complaint of the victim).

Offence: Sexual intercourse by a person in authority, etc.
Punishment: Rigorous imprisonment for not less than 5 years, but which may extend to 10 years and fine.

Offence: Sexual intercourse by employing deceitful means, etc.
Punishment: Rigorous imprisonment for not less than 20 years but which may extend to imprisonment for life which shall mean imprisonment for the remainder of that person's natural life and fine.

Offence: Gang rape.
Punishment: Imprisonment for life which shall mean imprisonment for the remainder of that person's natural life and with fine or with death.

Offence: Gang rape on a woman under eighteen years of age.
Punishment: Imprisonment for life which shall mean imprisonment for the remainder of that person's natural life and with fine or with death.

Offence: Repeat offenders.
Punishment: Imprisonment for life which shall mean imprisonment for the remainder of that person's natural life or with death.

Offence: Disclosure of identity of the victim of certain offences, etc.
Punishment: Imprisonment for not less than 2 years but which may extend to 5 years and fine.

Offence: Printing or publication of a proceeding without prior permission of court.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years and fine.

Offence: Assault or use of criminal force to woman with intent to outrage her modesty.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years and fine.

Offence: Sexual harassment and punishment for sexual harassment specified in clause (i) or clause (ii) or clause (iii) of sub-section (1).
Punishment: Imprisonment for 1 year, or fine, or both.

Offence: Sexual harassment and punishment for sexual harassment specified in clause (iv) of sub-section (1).
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Assault or use of criminal force to woman with intent to disrobe.
Punishment: Imprisonment for not less than 3 years but which may extend to 7 years and fine.

Offence: Voyeurism.
Punishment: Imprisonment for not less than 1 year but which may extend to 3 years and fine.

Offence: Stalking.
Punishment: Imprisonment for not less than 3 years but which may extend to 7 years and fine.

Offence: Second or subsequent conviction.
Punishment: Imprisonment for not less than 5 years but which may extend to 10 years and fine.

Offence: Uttering any word or making any gesture intended to insult the modesty of a woman, etc.
Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years and fine.

Offence: Dowry death.
Punishment: Imprisonment for not less than 7 years but which may extend to imprisonment for life.

Offence: A man by deceit causing a woman not lawfully married to him to believe, that she is lawfully married to him and to cohabit with him in that belief.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: Marrying again during the life time of a husband or wife.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years and fine.

Offence: Same offence with concealment of the former marriage from the person with whom subsequent marriage is contracted.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: A person with fraudulent intention going through the ceremony of being married, knowing that he is not thereby lawfully married.
Punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years and fine.

Offence: Enticing or taking away or detaining with a criminal intent a married woman.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Punishment for subjecting a married woman to cruelty.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years and fine.
Cognizable?: Cognizable if information relating to the commission of the offence is given to an officer in charge of a police station by the person aggrieved by the offence or by any person related to her by blood, marriage or adoption or if there is no such relative, by any public servant belonging to such class or category as may be notified by the State Government in this behalf.

Offence: Kidnapping, abducting or inducing woman to compel her marriage, etc.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: Causing miscarriage.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: If the woman be quick with child.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years and fine.

Offence: Causing miscarriage without women's consent.
Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: Death caused by an act done with intent to cause miscarriage.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: If act done without women's consent.
Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: Act done with intent to prevent a child being born alive, or to cause it to die after its birth.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 10 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Causing death of a quick unborn child by an act amounting to culpable homicide.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: Exposure of a child under 12 years of age by parent or person having care of it with intention of wholly abandoning it.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Concealment of birth by secret disposal of dead body.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Hiring, employing or engaging a child to commit an offence.
Punishment: Imprisonment for not less than 3 years but which may extend to 10 years and fine.

Offence: If offence be committed.
Punishment: Same as for the offence committed.
Triable By: Court by which offence committed is triable.

Offence: Procuration of child.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: Kidnapping or abducting a child under ten years with intent to steal from its person.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years and fine.

Offence: Selling child for purposes of prostitution, etc.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: Buying child for purposes of prostitution, etc.
Punishment: Imprisonment for not less than 7 years but which may extend to 14 years and fine.

Offence: Murder.
Punishment: Death or imprisonment for life and fine.

Offence: Murder by group of five or more persons.
Punishment: Death or with imprisonment for life and fine.

Offence: Murder by life-convict.
Punishment: Death or imprisonment for life, which shall mean the remainder of that person's natural life.

Offence: Culpable homicide not amounting to murder, if act by which the death is caused is done with intention of causing death, etc.
Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for not less than 5 years but which may extend to 10 years and fine.

Offence: Causing death by negligence.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 5 years and fine.

Offence: Causing death by rash and negligent driving of vehicle and escaping.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years and fine.

Offence: Abetment of suicide of child or person of unsound mind, etc.
Punishment: Death, or imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: Abetment of suicide.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: Attempt to murder.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: If such act causes hurt to any person.
Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: Attempt by life-convict to murder, if hurt is caused.
Punishment: Death, or imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: Attempt to commit culpable homicide.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years, or fine or both.

Offence: If such act causes hurt to any person.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Organised crime resulting in death of any person.
Punishment: Death or imprisonment for life and fine of not less than 10 lakh rupees.

Offence: In any other case.
Punishment: Imprisonment for not less than 5 years but which may extend to imprisonment for life and fine of not less than 5 lakh rupees.

Offence: Abetting, attempting, conspiring or knowingly facilitating the commission of organised crime.
Punishment: Imprisonment for not less than 5 years but which may extend to imprisonment for life and fine of not less than 5 lakh rupees.

Offence: Being a member of an organised crime syndicate.
Punishment: Imprisonment for not less than 5 years but which may extend to imprisonment for life and fine of not less than 5 lakh rupees.

Offence: Intentionally harbouring or concealing any person who committed offence of organised crime.
Punishment: Imprisonment for not less than 3 years but which may extend to imprisonment for life and fine of not less than 5 lakh rupees.

Offence: Possessing property derived, or obtained from the commission of organised crime.
Punishment: Imprisonment for not less than 3 years but which may extend to imprisonment for life and fine of not less than 2 lakh rupees.

Offence: Possessing property on behalf of a member of an organised crime syndicate.
Punishment: Imprisonment for not less than 3 years but which may extend to imprisonment for 10 years and fine of not less than 1 lakh rupees.

Offence: Petty Organised crime.
Punishment: Imprisonment for not less than 1 year but which may extend to 7 years and fine.

Offence: Terrorist act resulting in the death of any person.
Punishment: Death or imprisonment for life and fine.

Offence: In any other case.
Punishment: Imprisonment for not less than 5 years but which may extend to imprisonment for life and fine.

Offence: Conspiring, attempting, abetting, etc., or knowingly facilitating the commission of terrorist act.
Punishment: Imprisonment for not less than 5 years but which may extend to imprisonment for life and fine.

Offence: Organising camps, training, etc., for commission of terrorist act.
Punishment: Imprisonment for not less than 5 years but which may extend to imprisonment for life and fine.

Offence: Being a member of an organisation involved in terrorist act.
Punishment: Imprisonment for life and fine.

Offence: Harbouring, concealing, etc., of any person who committed a terrorist act.
Punishment: Imprisonment for not less than 3 years but which may extend to imprisonment for life and fine.

Offence: Possessing property derived or obtained from commission of terrorist act.
Punishment: Imprisonment for life and fine.

Offence: Voluntarily causing hurt.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 1 year or fine of 10,000 rupees, or both.

Offence: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years and fine.

Offence: If hurt to results in permanent disability or persistent vegetative state.
Punishment: Rigorous imprisonment for not less than 10 years but which may extend to imprisonment for life which shall mean the remainder of that person's natural life.

Offence: Grievous hurt caused by a group of 5 or more persons.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years and fine.

Offence: Voluntarily causing hurt by dangerous weapons or means.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years, or fine of 20,000 rupees, or both.

Offence: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt by dangerous weapons or means [except as provided in section 122(2)].
Punishment: Imprisonment for life or imprisonment of not less than 1 year to 10 years and fine.

Offence: Voluntarily causing hurt to extort property, or to constrain to an illegal act.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt for any purpose referred to in sub-section (1).
Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: Voluntarily causing hurt to extort confession or information, or to compel restoration of property, etc.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years and fine.

Offence: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt to extort confession or information, or to compel restoration of property, etc.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: Voluntarily causing hurt to deter public servant from his duty.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 5 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt to deter public servant from his duty.
Punishment: Imprisonment not less than 1 year, or imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: Voluntarily causing hurt on grave and sudden provocation, not intending to hurt any other than the person who gave the provocation.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 1 month, or fine of 5,000 rupees, or both.

Offence: Causing grievous hurt on grave and sudden provocation, not intending to hurt any other than the person who gave the provocation.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 5 years, or fine of 10,000 rupees, or both.

Offence: Causing hurt by means of poison, etc., with intent to commit an offence.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt by use of acid, etc.
Punishment: Imprisonment for not less than 10 years but which may extend to imprisonment for life and fine.

Offence: Voluntarily throwing or attempting to throw acid.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 5 years but which may extend to 7 years and fine.

Offence: Doing any act endangering human life personal safety of others.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 6 months, or fine of 2,500 rupees, or both.

Offence: Where hurt is caused.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 6 months, or fine of 5,000 rupees, or both.

Offence: Where grievous hurt is caused.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years, or fine of 10,000 rupees, or both.

Offence: Wrongfully restraining any person.
Punishment: Simple imprisonment for 1 month, or fine of 5,000 rupees, or both.

Offence: Wrongfully confining any person.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 1 year, or fine of 5,000 rupees, or both.

Offence: Wrongfully confining for three or more days.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years, or fine of 10,000 rupees, or both.

Offence: Wrongfully confining for 10 or more days.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 5 years and fine of 10,000 rupees.

Offence: Keeping any person in wrongful confinement, knowing that a writ has been issued for his liberation.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years in addition to any term of imprisonment under any other section and fine.

Offence: Wrongful confinement in secret.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years in addition to other punishment which he is liable to and fine.

Offence: Wrongful confinement for the purpose of extorting property, or constraining to an illegal act, etc.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years and fine.

Offence: Wrongful confinement for the purpose of extorting confession or information, or for compelling restoration of property, etc.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years and fine.

Offence: Assault or criminal force otherwise than on grave provocation.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 months, or fine of 1,000 rupees, or both.

Offence: Assault or use of criminal force to deter public servant from discharge of his duty.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Assault or criminal force with intent to dishonour a person, otherwise than on grave and sudden provocation.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Assault or criminal force in attempt to commit theft.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Assault or use of criminal force in attempt wrongfully to confine a person.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 1 year, or fine, or both.

Offence: Assault or use of criminal force on grave and sudden provocation.
Punishment: Simple imprisonment for 1 month, or fine of 200 rupees, or both.

Offence: Kidnapping.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years and fine.

Offence: Kidnapping a child for purposes of begging.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: Maiming a child for purposes of begging.
Punishment: Imprisonment not be less than 20 years which may extend to remainder of that person's natural life, and fine.

Offence: Kidnapping or abducting in order to murder.
Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or rigorous imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: Kidnapping for ransom, etc.
Punishment: Death, or imprisonment for life and fine.

Offence: Kidnapping or abducting with intent secretly and wrongfully to confine a person.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years and fine.

Offence: Kidnapping or abducting in order to subject a person to grievous hurt, slavery, etc.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: Importation of a girl or boy from foreign country.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: Wrongfully concealing or keeping in confinement, kidnapped or abducted person.
Punishment: Punishment for kidnapping or abduction.
Triable By: Court by which the kidnapping or abduction is triable.

Offence: Trafficking of person.
Punishment: Rigorous imprisonment for not less than 7 years but which may extend to 10 years and fine.

Offence: Trafficking of more than one person.
Punishment: Rigorous imprisonment for not less than 10 years but which may extend to imprisonment for life and fine.

Offence: Trafficking of a child.
Punishment: Rigorous imprisonment for not less than 10 years but which may extend to imprisonment for life and fine.

Offence: Trafficking of more than one child.
Punishment: Rigorous imprisonment for not less than 14 years but which may extend to imprisonment for life and fine.

Offence: Person convicted of offence of trafficking of child on more than one occasion.
Punishment: Imprisonment for life which shall mean the remainder of that person's natural life and fine.

Offence: Public servant or a police officer involved in trafficking of child.
Punishment: Rigorous imprisonment for not less than 10 years but which may extend to imprisonment for life and fine.

Offence: Exploitation of a trafficked child.
Punishment: Rigorous imprisonment for not less than 5 years but which may extend to 10 years and fine.

Offence: Exploitation of a trafficked person.
Punishment: Rigorous imprisonment for not less than 3 years but which may extend to 7 years and fine.

Offence: Habitual dealing in slaves.
Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: Unlawful compulsory labour.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 1 year, or fine, or both.

Offence: Waging or attempting to wage war, or abetting the waging of war, against the Government of India.
Punishment: Death, or imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: Conspiring to commit certain offences against the State.
Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: Collecting arms, etc., with the intention of waging war against the Government of India.
Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: Concealing with intent to facilitate a design to wage war.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: Assaulting President, Governor, etc., with intent to compel or restrain the exercise of any lawful power.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years and fine.

Offence: Act endangering sovereignty, unity and integrity of India.
Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for 7 years and fine.

Offence: Waging war against Government of any foreign State at peace with the Government of India.
Punishment: Imprisonment for life and fine, or imprisonment for 7 years and fine, or fine.

Offence: Committing depredation on the territories of any foreign state at peace with the Government of India.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years and fine, and forfeiture of certain property.

Offence: Receiving property taken by war or depredation mentioned in sections 153 and 154.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years and fine, and forfeiture of certain property.

Offence: Public servant voluntarily allowing prisoner of state or war in his custody to escape.
Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: Public servant negligently suffering prisoner of State or war in his custody to escape.
Punishment: Simple imprisonment for 3 years and fine.

Offence: Aiding escape of, rescuing or harbouring such prisoner.
Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: Abetting mutiny, or attempting to seduce an officer, soldier, sailor or airman from his allegiance or duty.
Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: Abetment of mutiny, if mutiny is committed in consequence thereof.
Punishment: Death, or imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: Abetment of assault by an officer, soldier, sailor or airman on his superior officer, when in execution of his office.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years and fine.

Offence: Abetment of such assault, if the assault committed.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years and fine.

Offence: Abetment of the desertion of an officer, soldier, sailor or airman.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Harbouring deserter.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Deserter concealed on board merchant vessel through negligence of master or person in charge thereof.
Punishment: Fine of 3,000 rupees.

Offence: Abetment of act of insubordination by an officer, soldier, sailor or airman if the offence be committed in consequence.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Wearing garb or carrying token used by soldier, sailor or airman.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 months, or fine of 2,000 rupees, or both.

Offence: Bribery.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 1 year or fine, or both, or if treating only, fine only.

Offence: Undue influence or personation at an election.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 1 year, or fine, or both.

Offence: False statement in connection with an election.
Punishment: Fine.

Offence: Illegal payments in connection with elections.
Punishment: Fine of 10,000 rupees.

Offence: Failure to keep election accounts.
Punishment: Fine of 5,000 rupees.

Offence: Counterfeiting coins, government stamps, currency-notes or bank-notes.
Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: Using as genuine forged or counterfeit coin, Government stamp currency-notes or bank-notes.
Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: Possession of forged or counterfeit coin, Government stamp, currency-notes or bank-notes.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Making, buying, selling or possessing machinery, instrument or material for forging or counterfeiting coins, Government stamp, currency-notes or bank-notes.
Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: Making or using documents resembling currency-notes or bank-notes.
Punishment: Fine of 300 rupees.

Offence: On refusal to disclose the name and address of the printer.
Punishment: Fine of 600 rupees.

Offence: Effacing any writing from substance bearing a Government stamp, removing from a document a stamp used for it, with intent to cause a loss to Government.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Using a Government stamp known to have been before used.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Erasure of mark denoting that stamps have been used.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Fictitious stamps.
Punishment: Fine of 200 rupees.

Offence: Person employed in a Mint causing coin to be of a different weight or composition from that fixed by law.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years and fine.

Offence: Unlawfully taking from a Mint any coining instrument.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years and fine.

Offence: Being member of an unlawful assembly.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 6 months, or fine, or both.

Offence: Joining or continuing in an unlawful assembly, knowing that it has been commanded to disperse.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Joining an unlawful assembly armed with any deadly weapon.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Knowingly joining or continuing in any assembly of five or more persons after it has been commanded to disperse.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 6 months, or fine, or both.

Offence: Hiring, engaging or employing persons to take part in an unlawful assembly.
Punishment: The same as for a member of such assembly, and for any offence committed by any member of such assembly.
Bailable?: According as offence is bailable or non-bailable.
Triable By: Court by which offence is triable.

Offence: Harbouring persons hired for an unlawful assembly.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 6 months, or fine, or both.

Offence: Being hired to take part in an unlawful assembly or riot.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 6 months, or fine, or both.

Offence: Or to go armed.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Every member of unlawful assembly guilty of offence committed in prosecution of common object.
Punishment: The same as for the offence.
Cognizable?: According as offence is cognizable or non-cognizable.
Bailable?: According as offence is bailable or non-bailable.
Triable By: Court by which offence is triable.

Offence: Rioting.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Rioting, armed with a deadly weapon.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 5 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Wantonly giving provocation with intent to cause riot, if rioting be committed.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 1 year, or fine, or both.

Offence: Owner or occupier of land or giving information of riot, etc.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 6 months, or fine, or both.

Offence: Person for whose benefit or on whose behalf a riot takes place not using all lawful means to prevent it.
Punishment: Fine.

Offence: Agent of owner or occupier for whose benefit a riot is committed not using all lawful means to prevent it.
Punishment: Fine.

Offence: Committing affray.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 1 month, or fine of 1,000 rupees, or both.

Offence: Assaulting or obstructing public servant when suppressing riot, etc.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years, or fine not less than 25,000 rupees, or both.

Offence: Threatening to assault or attempting to obstruct public servant when suppressing riot, etc.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 1 year, or fine, or both.

Offence: Promoting enmity between different groups on ground of religion, race, place of birth, residence, language, etc., and doing acts prejudicial to maintenance of harmony.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Promoting enmity between classes in place of worship, etc.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 5 years and fine.

Offence: Imputations, assertions prejudicial to national integration.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: If committed in a place of public worship, etc.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 5 years and fine.

Offence: Public servant disobeying direction of the law with intent to cause injury to any person.
Punishment: Simple imprisonment for 1 year, or fine, or both.

Offence: Public servant disobeying direction under law.
Punishment: Rigorous imprisonment for not less than 6 months which may extend to 2 years and fine.

Offence: Non-treatment of victim by hospital.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 1 year, or fine, or both.

Offence: Public servant framing an incorrect document with intent to cause injury.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Public servant unlawfully engaging in trade.
Punishment: Simple imprisonment for 1 year, or fine, or both, or community service.

Offence: Public servant unlawfully buying or bidding for property.
Punishment: Simple imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both and confiscation of property, if purchased.

Offence: Personating a public servant.
Punishment: Imprisonment for not less than 6 months but which may extend to 3 years and fine.

Offence: Wearing garb or carrying token used by public servant with fraudulent intent.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 months, or fine of 5,000 rupees, or both.

Offence: Absconding to avoid service of summons or other proceeding from a public servant.
Punishment: Simple imprisonment for 1 month, or fine of 5,000 rupees, or both.

Offence: If summons or notice require attendance in person, etc., in a Court.
Punishment: Simple imprisonment for 6 months, or fine of 10,000 rupees, or both.

Offence: Preventing service of summons or other proceeding, or preventing publication thereof.
Punishment: Simple imprisonment for 1 month, or fine of 5,000 rupees, or both.

Offence: If summons, etc., require attendance in person, etc., in a Court.
Punishment: Simple imprisonment for 6 months, or fine of 10,000 rupees, or both.

Offence: Non-attendance in obedience to an order from public servant.
Punishment: Simple imprisonment for 1 month, or fine of 5,000 rupees, or both.

Offence: If the order requires personal attendance, etc., in a Court.
Punishment: Simple imprisonment for 6 months, or fine of 10,000 rupees, or both.

Offence: Non-appearance in response to a proclamation under section 84 of this Sanhita.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years, or fine, or both, or community service.

Offence: In a case where declaration has been made under sub-section (4) of section 84 of this Sanhita pronouncing a person as proclaimed offender.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years and fine.

Offence: Omission to produce document to public servant by person legally bound to produce or deliver it.
Punishment: Simple imprisonment for 1 month, or fine of 5,000 rupees, or both.
Triable By: The Court in which the offence is committed, subject to the provisions of Chapter XXVIII; or, if not committed, in a Court, any Magistrate.

Offence: If the document is required to be produced in or delivered to a Court.
Punishment: Simple imprisonment for 6 months, or fine of 10,000 rupees, or both.
Triable By: The Court in which the offence is committed, subject to the provisions of Chapter XXVIII; or, if not committed, in a Court, any Magistrate.

Offence: Intentional omission to give notice or information to public servant by person legally bound to give it.
Punishment: Simple imprisonment for 1 month, or fine of 5,000 rupees, or both.

Offence: If the notice or information required respects the commission of an offence, etc.
Punishment: Simple imprisonment for 6 months, or fine of 10,000 rupees, or both.

Offence: If the notice or information is required by an order passed under sub-section (1) of section 394 of this Sanhita.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 6 months, or fine of 1,000 rupees, or both.

Offence: Knowingly furnishing false information to public servant.
Punishment: Simple imprisonment for 1 month, or fine of 5,000 rupees, or both.

Offence: If the information required respects the commission of an offence, etc.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Refusing oath when duly required to take oath by a public servant.
Punishment: Simple imprisonment for 1 month, or fine of 5,000 rupees, or both.
Triable By: The Court in which the offence is committed, subject to the provisions of Chapter XXVIII; or, if not committed, in a Court, any Magistrate.

Offence: Being legally bound to state truth, and refusing to answer public servant authorised to question.
Punishment: Simple imprisonment for 1 month, or fine of 5,000 rupees, or both.
Triable By: The Court in which the offence is committed, subject to the provisions of Chapter XXVIII; or, if not committed, in a Court, any Magistrate.

Offence: Refusing to sign a statement made to a public servant when legally required to do so.
Punishment: Simple imprisonment for 3 months, or fine of 3,000 rupees, or both.
Triable By: The Court in which the offence is committed, subject to the provisions of Chapter XXVIII; or, if not committed, in a Court, any Magistrate.

Offence: Knowingly stating to a public servant on oath as true that which is false.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years and fine.

Offence: Giving false information to a public servant in order to cause him to use his lawful power to the injury or annoyance of any person.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 1 year, or with fine of 10,000 rupees, or both.

Offence: Resistance to the taking property by the lawful authority of a public servant.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 6 months, or fine of 10,000 rupees, or both.

Offence: Obstructing sale of property offered for sale by authority of a public servant.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 1 month, or fine of 5,000 rupees, or both.

Offence: Illegal purchase or bid for property offered for sale by authority of public servant.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 1 month, or fine of 200 rupees, or both.

Offence: Obstructing public servant in discharge of his public functions.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 months, or fine of 2,500 rupees, or both.

Offence: Omission to assist public servant when bound by law to give such assistance.
Punishment: Simple imprisonment for 1 month, or fine of 2,500 rupees, or both.

Offence: Wilfully neglecting to aid a public servant who demands aid in the execution of process, the prevention of offences, etc.
Punishment: Simple imprisonment for 6 months, or fine of 5,000 rupees, or both.

Offence: Disobedience to an order lawfully promulgated by public servant, if such disobedience causes obstruction, annoyance or injury to persons lawfully employed.
Punishment: Simple imprisonment for 1 month, or fine of 2,500 rupees, or both.

Offence: If such disobedience causes danger to human life, health or safety, or causes or tends to cause a riot or affray.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 1 year, or fine of 5,000 rupees, or both.

Offence: Threat of injury to public servant, etc.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Threat of injury to induce person to refrain from applying for protection to public servant.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 1 year, or fine, or both.

Offence: Attempt to commit suicide to compel or restraint exercise of lawful power.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 1 year, or fine, or both, or community service.

Offence: Intentionally giving or fabricating false evidence in a judicial proceeding.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years and fine of 10,000 rupees.

Offence: Giving or fabricating false evidence in any other case.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years and fine of 5,000 rupees.

Offence: Giving or fabricating false evidence with intent to cause any person to be convicted of capital offence.
Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or rigorous imprisonment for 10 years and fine of 50,000 rupees.

Offence: If innocent person be thereby convicted and executed.
Punishment: Death, or as above.

Offence: Giving or fabricating false evidence with intent to procure conviction of an offence punishable with imprisonment for life or with imprisonment for 7 years, or upwards.
Punishment: The same as for the offence.

Offence: Threatening any person to give false evidence.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years, or fine, or both.
Triable By: Court by which offence of giving false evidence is triable.

Offence: If innocent person is convicted and sentenced in consequence of false evidence with death, or imprisonment for more than 7 years.
Punishment: The same as for the offence.
Triable By: Court by which offence of giving false evidence is triable.

Offence: Using in a judicial proceeding evidence known to be false or fabricated.
Punishment: The same as for giving or fabricating false evidence.
Bailable?: According as offence of giving such evidence is bailable or non-bailable.
Triable By: Court by which offence of giving or fabricating false evidence is triable.

Offence: Knowingly issuing or signing a false certificate relating to any fact of which such certificate is by law admissible in evidence.
Punishment: The same as for giving false evidence.
Triable By: Court by which offence of giving false evidence is triable.

Offence: Using as a true certificate one known to be false in a material point.
Punishment: The same as for giving false evidence.
Triable By: Court by which offence of giving false evidence is triable.

Offence: False statement made in any declaration which is by law receivable as evidence.
Punishment: The same as for giving false evidence.
Triable By: Court by which offence of giving false evidence is triable.

Offence: Using as true any such declaration known to be false.
Punishment: The same as for giving false evidence.
Triable By: Court by which offence of giving false evidence is triable.

Offence: Causing disappearance of evidence of an offence committed, or giving false information touching it to screen the offender, if a capital offence.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years and fine.
Cognizable?: According as the offence in relation to which disappearance of evidence is caused is cognizable or non-cognizable.

Offence: If punishable with imprisonment for life or imprisonment for 10 years.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years and fine.
Cognizable?: According as the offence in relation to which disappearance of evidence is caused is cognizable or non-cognizable.
Triable By: Court by which the offence is triable.

Offence: If punishable with less than 10 years' imprisonment.
Punishment: Imprisonment for one-fourth of the longest term provided for the offence, or fine, or both.
Cognizable?: According as the offence in relation to which disappearance of evidence is caused is cognizable or non-cognizable.
Triable By: Court by which the offence is triable.

Offence: Intentional omission to give information of an offence by a person legally bound to inform.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 6 months, or fine of 5,000 rupees, or both.

Offence: Giving false information respecting an offence committed.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Secreting or destroying any document to prevent its production as evidence.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years, or fine of 5,000 rupees, or both.

Offence: False personation for the purpose of any act or proceeding in a suit or criminal prosecution, or for becoming bail or security.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Fraudulent removal or concealment, etc., of property to prevent its seizure as a forfeiture or in satisfaction of a fine under sentence, or in execution of a decree.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years, or fine, of 5,000 rupees, or both.

Offence: Claiming property without right, or practising deception touching any right to it, to prevent its being taken as a forfeiture, or in satisfaction of a fine under sentence, or in execution of a decree.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Fraudulently suffering a decree to pass for a sum not due, or suffering decree to be executed after it has been satisfied.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: False claim in a Court.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years and fine.

Offence: Fraudulently obtaining a decree for a sum not due, or causing a decree to be executed after it has been satisfied.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: False charge of offence made with intent to injure.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 5 years, or fine of 2 lakh rupees, or both.

Offence: Criminal proceeding instituted on a false charge of an offence punishable with death, imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for ten years or upwards.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: Harbouring an offender, if the offence is punishable with death.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 5 years and fine.

Offence: If punishable with imprisonment for life or with imprisonment for 10 years.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years and fine.

Offence: If punishable with imprisonment for 1 year and not for 10 years.
Punishment: Imprisonment for one-fourth of the longest term, and of the descriptions, provided for the offence, or fine, or both.

Offence: Taking gift, etc., to screen an offender from punishment if the offence is punishable with death.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years and fine.

Offence: If punishable with imprisonment for life or with imprisonment for 10 years.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years and fine.

Offence: If punishable with imprisonment for less than 10 years.
Punishment: Imprisonment for one-fourth of the longest term provided for the offence, or fine, or both.

Offence: Offering gift or restoration of property in consideration of screening offender if the offence is punishable with death.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years and fine.

Offence: If punishable with imprisonment for life or with imprisonment for 10 years.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years and fine.

Offence: If punishable with imprisonment for less than 10 years.
Punishment: Imprisonment for one-fourth of the longest term, provided for the offence, or fine, or both.

Offence: Taking gift to help to recover movable property of which a person has been deprived by an offence without causing apprehension of offender.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Harbouring an offender who has escaped from custody, or whose apprehension has been ordered, if the offence is punishable with death.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years and fine.

Offence: If punishable with imprisonment for life or with imprisonment for 10 years.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years, with or without fine.

Offence: If punishable with imprisonment for 1 year and not for 10 years.
Punishment: Imprisonment for one-fourth of the longest term provided for the offence, or fine, or both.

Offence: Harbouring robbers or dacoits.
Punishment: Rigorous imprisonment for 7 years and fine.

Offence: Public servant disobeying a direction of law with intent to save person from punishment.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Public servant framing an incorrect record or writing with intent to save person from punishment.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Public servant in a judicial proceeding corruptly making and pronouncing an order, report, etc.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Commitment for trial or confinement by a person having authority, who knows that he is acting contrary to law.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Intentional omission to apprehend on the part of a public servant bound by law to apprehend an offender, if the offence is punishable with death.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years, with or without fine.
Cognizable?: According as the offence in relation to which such omission has been made is cognizable or non-cognizable.

Offence: If punishable with imprisonment for life or imprisonment for 10 years.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years, with or without fine.
Cognizable?: According as the offence in relation to which such omission has been made is cognizable or non-cognizable.

Offence: If punishable with imprisonment for less than 10 years.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, with or without fine.
Cognizable?: According as the offence in relation to which such omission has been made is cognizable or non-cognizable.

Offence: Intentional omission to apprehend on the part of a public servant bound by law to apprehend person under sentence of a Court if under sentence of death.
Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: If under sentence of imprisonment for life or imprisonment for 10 years, or upwards.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 14 years, with or without fine.

Offence: If under sentence of imprisonment for less than 10 years or lawfully committed to custody.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Escape from confinement negligently suffered by a public servant.
Punishment: Simple imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Resistance or obstruction by a person to his lawful apprehension.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Resistance or obstruction to the lawful apprehension of any person, or rescuing him from lawful custody.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: If charged with an offence punishable with imprisonment for life or imprisonment for 10 years.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years and fine.

Offence: If charged with offence punishable with death.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years and fine.

Offence: If the person is sentenced to imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for 10 years, or upwards.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years and fine.

Offence: If under sentence of death.
Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: Omission to apprehend, or sufferance of escape on part of public servant, in cases not otherwise provided for:-- (a) in case of intentional omission or sufferance; (b) in case of negligent omission or sufferance.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years, or fine, or both. Simple imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Resistance or obstruction to lawful apprehension, or escape or rescue in cases not otherwise provided for.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 6 months, or fine, or both.

Offence: Violation of condition of remission of punishment.
Punishment: Punishment of original sentence, or if part of the punishment has been undergone, the residue.
Triable By: The Court by which the original offence was triable.

Offence: Intentional insult or interruption to a public servant sitting in any stage of a judicial proceeding.
Punishment: Simple imprisonment for 6 months, or fine of 5,000 rupees, or both.
Triable By: The Court in which the offence is committed, subject to the provisions of Chapter XXVIII; or, if not committed, in a Court, any Magistrate.

Offence: Personation of an assessor.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Failure by person released on bond or bail bond to appear in Court.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 1 year, or fine, or both.
Triable By: The Court in which the offence is committed, subject to the provisions of Chapter XXVIII; or, if not committed, in a Court, any Magistrate.

Offence: Negligently doing any act known to be likely to spread infection of any disease dangerous to life.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 6 months, or fine, or both.

Offence: Malignantly doing any act known to be likely to spread infection of any disease dangerous to life.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Knowingly disobeying any quarantine rule.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 6 months, or fine, or both.

Offence: Adulterating food or drink intended for sale, so as to make the same noxious.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 6 months, or fine of 5,000 rupees, or both.

Offence: Selling any food or drink as food and drink, knowing the same to be noxious.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 6 months, or fine of 5,000 rupees, or both.

Offence: Adulterating any drug or medical preparation intended for sale so as to lessen its efficacy, or to change its operation, or to make it noxious.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 1 year, or fine of 5,000 rupees, or both.

Offence: Sale of adulterated drugs.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 6 months, or fine of 5,000 rupees, or both.

Offence: Knowingly selling of drug as a different drug or preparation.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 6 months, or fine of 5,000 rupees, or both.

Offence: Fouling water of public spring or reservoir.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 6 months, or fine of 5,000 rupees, or both.

Offence: Making atmosphere noxious to health.
Punishment: Fine of 1,000 rupees.

Offence: Rash driving or riding on a public way.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 6 months, or fine of 1,000 rupees, or both.

Offence: Rash navigation of vessel.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 6 months, or fine of 10,000 rupees, or both.

Offence: Exhibition of a false light, mark or buoy.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years, and fine which shall not be less than 10,000 rupees.

Offence: Conveying person by water for hire in unsafe or overloaded vessel.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 6 months, or fine of 5,000 rupees, or both.

Offence: Causing danger or obstruction in public way or line of navigation.
Punishment: Fine of 5,000 rupees.

Offence: Negligent conduct with respect to poisonous substance.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 6 months, or fine of 5,000 rupees, or both.

Offence: Negligent conduct with respect to fire or combustible matter.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 6 months, or fine of 2,000 rupees, or both.

Offence: Negligent conduct with respect to explosive substance.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 6 months, or fine of 5,000 rupees, or both.

Offence: Negligent conduct with respect to machinery.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 6 months, or fine of 5,000 rupees, or both.

Offence: Negligent conduct with respect to pulling down, repairing or constructing buildings, etc.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 6 months, or fine of 5,000 rupees, or both.

Offence: Negligent conduct with respect to animal.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 6 months, or fine of 5,000 rupees, or both.

Offence: Committing public nuisance in cases not otherwise provided for.
Punishment: Fine of 1,000 rupees.

Offence: Continuance of nuisance after injunction to discontinue.
Punishment: Simple imprisonment for 6 months, or fine of 5,000 rupees, or both.

Offence: Sale, etc., of obscene books, etc.
Punishment: On first conviction, with imprisonment for 2 years, and with fine of 5,000 rupees, and, in the event of second or subsequent conviction, with imprisonment for 5 years, and with fine of 10,000 rupees.

Offence: Sale, etc., of obscene objects to child.
Punishment: On first conviction, with imprisonment for 3 years, and with fine of 2,000 rupees, and in the event of second or subsequent conviction, with imprisonment for 7 years, and with fine of 5,000 rupees.

Offence: Obscene acts and songs.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 months, or fine of 1,000 rupees, or both.

Offence: Keeping a lottery office.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 6 months, or fine, or both.

Offence: Publishing proposals relating to lotteries.
Punishment: Fine of 1,000 rupees.

Offence: Defiling, etc., place of worship, with intent to insult the religion of any class.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Deliberate and malicious acts, intended to outrage religious feelings of any class by insulting its religion or religious beliefs.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Disturbing religious assembly.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 1 year, or fine, or both.

Offence: Trespassing on burial places, etc.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 1 year, or fine, or both.

Offence: Uttering words, etc., with deliberate intent to wound religious feelings.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 1 year, or fine, or both.

Offence: Theft.
Punishment: Rigorous imprisonment for not be less than 1 year but which may extend to 5 years, and fine.

Offence: Where value of property is less than 5,000 rupees.
Punishment: Upon return of the value of property or restoration of the stolen property, shall be punished with community service.

Offence: Snatching.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years and fine.

Offence: Theft in a dwelling house, or means of transportation or place of worship, etc.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years and fine.

Offence: Theft by clerk or servant of property in possession of master or employer.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Extortion.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years and fine.

Offence: Putting or attempting to put in fear of injury, in order to commit extortion.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Putting or attempting to put a person in fear of death or grievous hurt in order to commit extortion.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years and fine.

Offence: Extortion by putting a person in fear of death or grievous hurt.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: Putting a person in fear of accusation of an offence punishable with death, imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for 10 years in order to commit extortion.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: Extortion by threat of accusation of an offence punishable with death, imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for 10 years.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: Robbery.
Punishment: Rigorous imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: If robbery committed on highway between sunset and sunrise.
Punishment: Rigorous imprisonment for 14 years.

Offence: Attempt to commit robbery.
Punishment: Rigorous imprisonment for 7 years and fine.

Offence: Causing hurt.
Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or rigorous imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: Dacoity.
Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or rigorous imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: Murder in dacoity.
Punishment: Death, imprisonment for life, or rigorous imprisonment for not less than 10 years and fine.

Offence: Making preparation to commit dacoity.
Punishment: Rigorous imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: Being one of five or more persons assembled for the purpose of committing dacoity.
Punishment: Rigorous imprisonment for 7 years and fine.

Offence: Belonging to a gang of persons associated for the purpose of habitually committing dacoity.
Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: Robbery or dacoity, with attempt to cause death or grievous hurt.
Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: Attempt to commit robbery or dacoity when armed with deadly weapon.
Punishment: Imprisonment for not less than 7 years.

Offence: Belonging to a wandering gang of persons associated for the purpose of habitually committing thefts.
Punishment: Rigorous imprisonment for 7 years and fine.

Offence: Dishonest misappropriation of movable property, or converting it to one's own use.
Punishment: Imprisonment of not less than 6 months which may extend to 2 years and fine.

Offence: Dishonest misappropriation of property possessed by deceased person at the time of his death.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years and fine.

Offence: If by clerk or person employed by deceased.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years.

Offence: Criminal breach of trust.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 5 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Criminal breach of trust by a carrier, wharfinger, etc.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years and fine.

Offence: Criminal breach of trust by a clerk or servant.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years and fine.

Offence: Criminal breach of trust by public servant or by banker, merchant or agent, etc.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: Dishonestly receiving stolen property knowing it to be stolen.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Dishonestly receiving stolen property, knowing that it was obtained by dacoity.
Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or rigorous imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: Habitually dealing in stolen property.
Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: Assisting in concealment or disposal of stolen property, knowing it to be stolen.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Cheating.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Cheating a person whose interest the offender was bound, either by law or by legal contract, to protect.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 5 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Cheating and dishonestly inducing delivery of property.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years and fine.

Offence: Cheating by personation.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 5 years, or with fine, or with both.

Offence: Fraudulent removal or concealment of property, etc., to prevent distribution among creditors.
Punishment: Imprisonment of not be less than 6 months but which may extend to 2 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Dishonest or fraudulently preventing from being made available for his creditors a debt or demand due to the offender.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Dishonest or fraudulent execution of deed of transfer containing a false statement of consideration.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Fraudulent removal or concealment of property, of himself or any other person or assisting in the doing thereof, or dishonestly releasing any demand or claim to which he is entitled.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Mischief.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 6 months, or fine, or both.

Offence: Mischief causing loss or damage to any property including property of Government or Local Authority.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 1 year, or fine, or both.

Offence: Mischief causing loss or damage to the amount of twenty thousand rupees but less than 2 lakh rupees.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Mischief causing loss or damage to the amount of one lakh rupees or upwards.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 5 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Mischief with preparation for causing to any person death, or hurt, or wrongful restraint, or fear of death, or of hurt, or of wrongful restraint.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 5 years, and fine.

Offence: Mischief by killing or maiming animal.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 5 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Mischief by causing diminution of supply of water for agricultural purposes, etc.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 5 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Mischief by injury to public road, bridge, navigable river, or navigable channel, and rendering it impassable or less safe for travelling or conveying property.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 5 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Mischief by causing inundation or obstruction to public drainage attended with damage.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 5 years, or with fine, or with both.

Offence: Mischief by destroying or moving or rendering less useful a lighthouse or seamark, or by exhibiting false lights.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Mischief by destroying or moving, etc., a landmark fixed by public authority.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 1 year, or fine, or both.

Offence: Mischief by fire or explosive substance with intent to cause damage.
Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: Mischief by fire or explosive substance with intent to destroy a house, etc.
Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: Mischief with intent to destroy or make unsafe a decked vessel or a vessel of 20 tonnes burden.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: The mischief described in the last section when committed by fire or any explosive substance.
Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: Running vessel with intent to commit theft, etc.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: Criminal trespass.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 months, or fine of 5,000 rupees, or both.

Offence: House-trespass.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 1 year, or fine of 5,000 rupees, or both.

Offence: Lurking house-trespass or house-breaking.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years and fine.

Offence: Lurking house-trespass or house-breaking by night.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years and fine.

Offence: Lurking house-trespass or house-breaking in order to the commission of an offence punishable with imprisonment.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years and fine.

Offence: If the offence be theft.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 10 years.

Offence: Lurking house-trespass or house-breaking by night in order to the commission of an offence punishable with imprisonment.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 5 years and fine.

Offence: If the offence be theft.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 14 years.

Offence: Lurking house-trespass or house-breaking after preparation made for causing hurt, assault, etc.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: Lurking house-trespass or house-breaking by night, after preparation made for causing hurt, etc.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 14 years and fine.

Offence: Grievous hurt caused whilst committing lurking house-trespass or house-breaking.
Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: Death or grievous hurt caused by one of several persons jointly concerned in house-breaking by night, etc.
Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: House-trespass in order to the commission of an offence punishable with death.
Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or rigorous imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: House-trespass in order to the commission of an offence punishable with imprisonment for life.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: House-trespass in order to the commission of an offence punishable with imprisonment.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years and fine.

Offence: If the offence is theft.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years.

Offence: House-trespass, having made preparation for causing hurt, assault, etc.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years and fine.

Offence: Dishonestly breaking open or unfastening any closed receptacle containing or supposed to contain property.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Being entrusted with any closed receptacle containing or supposed to contain any property, and fraudulently opening the same.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Forgery.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Forgery for the purpose of cheating.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years and fine.

Offence: Forgery for the purpose of harming the reputation of any person or knowing that it is likely to be used for that purpose.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years and fine.

Offence: Forgery of a record of a Court or of a Registrar of Births, etc., kept by a public servant.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years and fine

Offence: Forgery of a valuable security, will, or authority to make or transfer any valuable security, or to receive any money, etc.
Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: When the valuable security is a promissory note of the Central Government.
Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

Offence: Having possession of a document, knowing it to be forged, with intent to use it as genuine; if the document is one of the description mentioned in section 337.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years and fine.

Offence: If the document is one of the description mentioned in section 338.
Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for 7 years and fine.

Offence: Using as genuine a forged document which is known to be forged.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years and fine.

Offence: Making or counterfeiting a seal, plate, etc., with intent to commit a forgery punishable under section 338 or possessing with like intent any such seal, plate, etc., knowing the same to be counterfeit.
Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for 7 years and fine.

Offence: Making or counterfeiting a seal, plate, etc., with intent to commit a forgery punishable otherwise than under section 338 or possessing with like intent any such seal, plate, etc., knowing the same to be counterfeit.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years and fine.

Offence: Possesses any seal, plate or other instrument knowing the same to be counterfeit.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years and fine.

Offence: Fraudulently or dishonestly uses as genuine any seal, plate or other instrument knowing or having reason to believe the same to be counterfeit.
Punishment: Same as if he had made or counterfeited such seal, plate or other instrument.

Offence: Counterfeiting a device or mark used for authenticating documents described in section 338 or possessing counterfeit marked material.
Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for 7 years and fine.

Offence: Counterfeiting a device or mark used for authenticating documents other than those described in section 338 or possessing counterfeit marked material.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years and fine.

Offence: Fraudulently destroying or defacing, or attempting to destroy or deface, or secreting, a will, etc.
Punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for 7 years and fine.

Offence: Falsification of accounts.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Using a false property mark with intent to deceive or injure any person.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 1 year, or fine, or both.

Offence: Removing, destroying or defacing property mark with intent to cause injury.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 1 year, or fine, or both.

Offence: Counterfeiting a property mark used by another, with intent to cause damage or injury.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Counterfeiting a property mark used by a public servant, or any mark used by him to denote the manufacture, quality, etc., of any property.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years and fine.

Offence: Fraudulently making or having possession of any die, plate or other instrument for counterfeiting any public or private property mark.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years and fine.

Offence: Knowingly selling goods marked with a counterfeit property mark.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 1 year, or fine, or both.

Offence: Fraudulently making a false mark upon any package or receptacle containing goods, with intent to cause it to be believed that it contains goods, which it does not contain, etc.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 1 year, or fine, or both.

Offence: Making use of any such false mark.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 1 year, or fine, or both.

Offence: Criminal intimidation.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: If threat be to cause death or grievous hurt, etc.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Criminal intimidation by anonymous communication or having taken precaution to conceal whence the threat comes.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, in addition to the punishment under sub-section (2) or sub-section (3).

Offence: Insult intended to provoke breach of the peace.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: False statement, rumour, etc., circulated with intent to cause mutiny or offence against the public peace.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: False statement, rumour, etc., with intent to create enmity, hatred or ill-will between different classes.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: False statement, rumour, etc., made in place of worship, etc., with intent to create enmity, hatred or ill-will.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 5 years and fine.

Offence: Act caused by inducing a person to believe that he will be rendered an object of Divine displeasure.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 1 year, or fine, or both.

Offence: Appearing in a public place, etc., in a state of intoxication, and causing annoyance to any person.
Punishment: Simple imprisonment for 24 hours, or fine of 1,000 rupees, or both.

Offence: Defamation against the President or the Vice-President or the Governor of a State or Administrator of a Union territory or a Minister in respect of his conduct in the discharge of his public functions when instituted upon a complaint made by the Public Prosecutor.
Punishment: Simple imprisonment for 2 years, or fine or both or community service.

Offence: Defamation in any other case.
Punishment: Simple imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Printing or engraving matter knowing it to be defamatory against the President or the Vice-President or the Governor of a State or Administrator of a Union territory or a Minister in respect of his conduct in the discharge of his public functions when instituted upon a complaint made by the Public Prosecutor.
Punishment: Simple imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Printing or engraving matter knowing it to be defamatory, in any other case.
Punishment: Simple imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Sale of printed or engraved substance containing defamatory matter, knowing it to contain such matter against the President or the Vice-President or the Governor of a State or Administrator of a Union territory or a Minister in respect of his conduct in the discharge of his public functions when instituted upon a complaint made by the Public Prosecutor.
Punishment: Simple imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Sale of printed or engraved substance containing defamatory matter, knowing it to contain such matter in any other case.
Punishment: Simple imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both.

Offence: Being bound to attend on or supply the wants of a person who is helpless from youth, unsoundness of mind or disease, and voluntarily omitting to do so.
Punishment: Imprisonment for 3 months, or fine of 5,000 rupees, or both.
